comments.author: Betty Ann @Mango_Queen
comments.content: Chickpeas and zucchini together in a dish? This is going to be a new favorite for us! You made it seem so easy, so that's a bonus, too. And I like your suggestion of using a mint tea bag. I never thought I could do that. Thanks for sharing the recipe, Michael!

comments.author: Marina@Picnic at Marina
comments.content: Hi Michael, Lovely recipe, as always. And it's all about spices and herbs that make this dish special.  I have to de-tour step one as my kitchen doesn't have microwave oven (by choice). :)

comments.author: Eileen
comments.content: Why have I never thought to rip open a mint teabag in a mint-related emergency?  That is brilliant!  :)  I love tagines, and can't wait to try out this combination.

comments.author: Marina@Picnic at Marina
comments.content: Michael, I made a post about Kitchen arts and Letters, come see it, on the second photo in the corner there is your book! :)

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Nice, I just checked it out (http://www.picnicatmarina.com/2012/08/kitchen-arts-and-letters.html) - they sure are a fantastic resource. Thanks for sharing!

comments.author: Vegan
comments.content: This dish looks fantastic. I'm glad you provided the recipe. I am a vegetarian and I love adding up lots of vegetables in my dishes. What other vegetables would go with this dish?

comments.author: Jay Edgar
comments.content: The links on the three ingredients all go to the same place--an Amazon search for "tajine..."

comments.author: Martin
comments.content: ras el hanout rocks! I just made a ratatouille with chick peas using  ras el hanout  as my main spice: got rave reviews (and my neighbor was happy to have found a home for his 7 pound zucchini).

comments.author: Sandy Scott
comments.content: I made this last night - it was fantastic!  I used a mix of green patty pan squash and zucchini squash.  Thanks so much for the recipe!

comments.author: Helen
comments.content:
Hi Michael.........greetings from New Zealand :)

Could I please ask if this could be made the day before, stored in the fridge, then re-heated the next day...??   If so is the microwave the better option.  Going to a friends Moroccan Themed Dinner Party and we are all bringing one main and one starter or side dish.   I won't have much time on the day, so if it reheats well........this one looks a real winner.  Thank you Michael

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: It should reheat just fine; hold off obviously on the parsley garnish until after it comes out of the microwave. Enjoy!
